prd.overview: The Simple Calculator App is designed to provide users with a straightforward interface for performing basic arithmetic operations. It will support addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division while also displaying a history of calculations for user reference.
goals: Provide a user-friendly interface for basic arithmetic operations.
Ensure compatibility with mobile devices for on-the-go usage.
Display a clear history of calculations performed by the user.
Achieve a minimum user satisfaction rating of 80% in initial user testing.
Ensure the app is responsive and performs well across different devices and screen sizes.
non_goals: Implement advanced mathematical functions beyond basic operations.
Provide a desktop application version at this stage.
Include user accounts or login features.
Support multiple languages in the initial release.
Integrate third-party APIs for additional functionalities.
target_users: Casual users looking for a quick calculation tool.
Students needing a simple calculator for homework.
Professionals requiring basic arithmetic for work-related tasks.
nice_to_have_features: Dark mode for better usability in low-light environments.
Export calculation history to a text file.
Integration with cloud storage for saving history.
user_stories: As a user, I want to perform addition so that I can calculate sums easily.
As a user, I want to perform subtraction so that I can find differences quickly.
As a user, I want to perform multiplication so that I can calculate products efficiently.
As a user, I want to perform division so that I can determine quotients without hassle.
As a user, I want to see my calculation history so that I can refer back to previous results.
As a mobile user, I want the app to be responsive so that I can use it comfortably on my device.
As a user, I want a clean interface so that I can focus on my calculations without distractions.
As a user, I want the app to load quickly so that I can perform calculations without delays.
acceptance_criteria: The app must support addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division operations.
The calculation history must display the last 10 calculations performed by the user.
The interface must be responsive and function correctly on mobile devices.
The app must load within 2 seconds on a standard mobile network.
User feedback must indicate a satisfaction rating of at least 80% during testing.
technical_stack_recommendation: React or Vue.js for a dynamic user interface
Node.js for any backend processing (if needed)
assumptions: The app will be a web-based application accessible via browsers.
Users will have internet access to use the app.
The app will not require user authentication or data storage beyond session history.
open_questions: What specific design elements do you envision for the user interface?
Are there any particular mobile devices or browsers we should prioritize for testing?
What is the expected timeline for the initial release of the app?
Do you have any preferences for the technology stack beyond what is suggested?
How should we handle edge cases, such as division by zero?
